item.title: Twitter Is DDOSing Itself
item.description: - Twitter is experiencing a Distributed Denial of Service attack (DDoS), which is causing the site to become slow or unresponsive.

item.title: How to Do Great Work
item.description: - Choosing work that excites and interests you is crucial for doing great work.

item.title: Far Cry 1.34 source code (2006)
item.description: - The source code for Far Cry version 1.34 has been leaked, allowing users to potentially modify the PC version of the game and add support for the Ubisoft game launcher / DRM.

item.title: Tell HN: Twitter switched temporarily to rate limited mode
item.description: - Twitter recently implemented a temporary measure called rate limited mode.

item.title: Fake reviews are illegal & subject to big fines under new FTC rules
item.description: - The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has proposed new rules to combat fake online reviews, with fines of up to $50,000 for each fake review.

item.title: It appears that Twitter is DDoSing itself
item.description: - Twitter is experiencing a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack, which means that its servers are being overwhelmed with a huge amount of traffic, making the platform inaccessible to its users.

item.title: Gping â€“ ping, but with a graph
item.description: - gping is a tool that allows you to ping hosts and graph the ping time.

item.title: Louis Rossmann: Autodesk turns lifetime licenses into subscriptions [video]
item.description: - Louis Rossmann, a well-known tech YouTuber, has made a video discussing Autodesk's decision to turn their lifetime licenses into subscription-based models.

item.title: Lemmy now has over 2M users across 915 instances
item.description: - 'Lemmy', a platform similar to Reddit, now has more than 2 million users across 915 instances.

item.title: VUDA: A Vulkan Implementation of CUDA
item.description: - VUDA is a library that allows developers to write GPU-accelerated applications using CUDA Runtime API interface.
